revised_title: On the Foundations of Probability Theory
tldr: This paper investigates the analytical conditions of a method for solving problems in probability theory, which was proposed by George Boole in his work "An Investigation of the Laws of Thought." The author discusses the principles of the method, including the translation of data into probabilities of events connected by logical conditions and the use of the Calculus of Logic to construct problems from ideal events. The paper also explores the difference between logical impossibility and actual non-existence in probability calculations.
